intro: Cuphea vesiculigera, commonly known as the bubblecup, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy red or pink tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, round seed pods that resemble bubbles, giving it its common name. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Cuphea vesiculigera is a member of the Lythraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar floral structures.
